page.title: 09Farming A year's diary
page.content: One farmer's report for 1985. We had 60 Friesian cows milking twice daily. We were over-cautious and did not produce to full potential so were 5000 litres under quota in March. Over-quota now but may avoid levy. 20 Friesian bullocks and 19 Aberdeen Angus cross-bred beef calves to improve income. Instead of barley we sowed 10 acres of Protein peas for stock feed but they were totally lost because of heavy rain. 100 acres of silo was cut twice but very late and we had no weather fit for hay to feed calves. Beef animals have done well but wonder whether to sell now at Â£300 or over-winter and hope for Â£475 in spring.
